org.microbean.narayana.jta.cdi

Class NarayanaTransactionManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.microbean.narayana.jta.cdi.DelegatingTransactionManager
      • org.microbean.narayana.jta.cdi.NarayanaTransactionManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TransactionManager

    @ApplicationScoped
public class NarayanaTransactionManager
extends DelegatingTransactionManager
    A DelegatingTransactionManager in application scope that uses the return value that results from invoking the JTAEnvironmentBean.getTransactionManager() method as its backing implementation.
    Author:
    Laird Nelson
    See Also:
    JTAEnvironmentBean.getTransactionManager()

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
      protected NarayanaTransactionManager()
      Deprecated. 
      This constructor exists only to conform with section 3.11 of the CDI specification; please use the NarayanaTransactionManager(JTAEnvironmentBean, Event, Event) constructor instead.
        NarayanaTransactionManager(JTAEnvironmentBean jtaEnvironmentBean, Event<Transaction> transactionScopeInitializedBroadcaster, Event<Object> transactionScopeDestroyedBroadcaster)
      Creates a new NarayanaTransactionManager.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void begin()
      Overrides DelegatingTransactionManager.begin() to additionally fire an Object representing the initialization of the transaction scope.
      void commit()
      Overrides DelegatingTransactionManager.commit() to additionally fire an Object representing the destruction of the transaction scope.
      void rollback()
      Overrides DelegatingTransactionManager.rollback() to additionally fire an Object representing the destruction of the transaction scope.

      • Methods inherited from class org.microbean.narayana.jta.cdi.DelegatingTransactionManager

        getStatus, getTransaction, resume, setRollbackOnly, setTransactionTimeout, suspend

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • NarayanaTransactionManager

        @Deprecated
protected NarayanaTransactionManager()
        Deprecated. This constructor exists only to conform with section 3.11 of the CDI specification; please use the NarayanaTransactionManager(JTAEnvironmentBean, Event, Event) constructor instead.
        Creates a new, nonfunctional NarayanaTransactionManager.

        This constructor exists only to conform with section 3.11 of the CDI specification.

      • NarayanaTransactionManager

        @Inject
public NarayanaTransactionManager(JTAEnvironmentBean jtaEnvironmentBean,
                                          @Initialized(value=javax.transaction.TransactionScoped.class)
                                          Event<Transaction> transactionScopeInitializedBroadcaster,
                                          @Destroyed(value=javax.transaction.TransactionScoped.class)
                                          Event<Object> transactionScopeDestroyedBroadcaster)
        Creates a new NarayanaTransactionManager.
        Parameters:
        jtaEnvironmentBean - a JTAEnvironmentBean used to acquire this NarayanaTransactionManager's delegate; must not be null
        transactionScopeInitializedBroadcaster - an Event capable of firing Transaction instances; may be null
        transactionScopeDestroyedBroadcaster - an Event capable of firing Object instances; may be null
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if jtaEnvironmentBean is null
        See Also:
        begin(), commit(), rollback()

    • Method Detail

      • begin

        public void begin()
           throws NotSupportedException,
                  SystemException
        Overrides DelegatingTransactionManager.begin() to additionally fire an Object representing the initialization of the transaction scope.
        Specified by:
        begin in interface TransactionManager
        Overrides:
        begin in class DelegatingTransactionManager
        Throws:
        NotSupportedException - if the thread is already associated with a transaction and this TransactionManager implementation does not support nested transactions
        SystemException - if this TransactionManager encounters an unexpected error condition
        See Also:
        DelegatingTransactionManager.begin(), Event.fire(Object), Initialized, TransactionScoped

      • commit

        public void commit()
            throws HeuristicMixedException,
                   HeuristicRollbackException,
                   RollbackException,
                   SystemException
        Overrides DelegatingTransactionManager.commit() to additionally fire an Object representing the destruction of the transaction scope.
        Specified by:
        commit in interface TransactionManager
        Overrides:
        commit in class DelegatingTransactionManager
        Throws:
        RollbackException - if the transaction has been rolled back rather than committed
        HeuristicMixedException - if a heuristic decision was made and that some relevant updates have been committed while others have been rolled back
        HeuristicRollbackException - if a heuristic decision was made and all relevant updates have been rolled back
        SecurityException - if the thread is not allowed to commit the transaction
        IllegalStateException - if the current thread is not associated with a transaction
        SystemException - if this TransactionManager encounters an unexpected error condition
        See Also:
        DelegatingTransactionManager.commit(), Event.fire(Object), Destroyed, TransactionScoped

      • rollback

        public void rollback()
              throws SystemException
        Overrides DelegatingTransactionManager.rollback() to additionally fire an Object representing the destruction of the transaction scope.
        Specified by:
        rollback in interface TransactionManager
        Overrides:
        rollback in class DelegatingTransactionManager
        Throws:
        SecurityException - if the thread is not allowed to roll back the transaction
        IllegalStateException - if the current thread is not associated with a transaction
        SystemException - if this TransactionManager encounters an unexpected error condition
        See Also:
        DelegatingTransactionManager.rollback(), Event.fire(Object), Destroyed, TransactionScoped
